JPN 401 Flashcards

The flashcards on this page are formatted for Anki, a spaced repetition flashcard program that is particularly well suited for learning languages like Japanese. Please tell me if you find any errors or other problems in the files.

    • Updated articles 1-5, adding a few missing cards. If you re-import the articles deck, you should get all the new cards.
    • Added instuctions on importing from text files.

Flashcard Files

Note that the articles are ordered based on the course pack, so "Benron" is "article9", not "article5".

Preconfigured Anki Decks

This files can be imported in Anki using File->Import, and will give you all the cards with no further configuration. You may want to hide or delete cards with the tag "vocab_opt".

IMPORTANT: to download, you must right click on links and choose "Save Link As..." or something similar.

Manga (Seiji)

Source Files

IMPORTANT: to download, you must right click on links and choose "Save Link As..." or something similar.

Excel files:

Tab-separated text files:
  • Articles 1-9 (all)
  • Manga (Seiji)
  • Drama 1.3-3.3 (all)
You may need to modify the card files in order to use them with programs other than Anki (though I have no idea why you would).

About the Flashcard Files

The flashcard files on this page are formatted and tagged so that Anki can can produce multiple "cards" for the same "fact", which includes the Japanese word/expression, Hiragana pronunciation (if the item has any Kanji), and it's meaning in English or using Japanese synonyms.

Card types used:

  • Japanese/Pronunciation -> Meaning
  • Meaning -> Japanese/Pronunciation
  • Kanji -> Pronunciation/Meaning
  • Pronunciation/Meaning -> Kanji

ex. Fact and Corresponding Cards:

Fact:

ItemReadingMeaning
日本語にほんごJapanese language

Cards:

QuestionAnswer
日本語 / にほんごJapanese language
Japanese lanugage日本語 / にほんご
日本語にほんご / Japanese language
にほんご / Japanese language日本語


This is done using a series of tags:
  • [Article/Hanayome section]
  • One of the following vocab tags:
    • vocab_know -- generate Japanese/Pronunciation -> Meaning    and    Meaning -> Japanese/Pronunciation
    • vocab_rec -- generate only Japanese/Pronunciation -> Meaning
    • vocab_opt -- generate only Japanese/Pronunciation -> Meaning (can be hidden in Anki without affecting other cards)
    • vocab_old -- used when Kanji are introduced for old vocab (can delete all non-Kanji cards with this tag)
  • No more than one of the the following Kanji tags:
    • kanji_rw -- genrerate Kanji -> Pronunciation/Meaning    and    Pronunciation/Meaning -> Kanji
    • kanji_r -- generate only Kanji -> Pronunciation/Meaning
You can use the article/drama tags and "vocab_opt" to hide cards you don't want to review at the moment.

Once you generate the cards in Anki (or use the preconfigured deck), each card will get an additional card tag representing the card layout described above:
  • Japanese->Meaning
  • Meaning->Japanese
  • KanjiReading
  • KanjiWriting
These tags can also be used to filter which cards appear during review.

Importing Text Files in Anki

  1. Import the facts.
    1. File->Import. Choose the file you want to import.
    2. Click the "cards" button. Tell Anki to produce only "Japanese->Meaning" cards.
    3. Import all cards.
  2. Generate cards.
    1. Open the search tool (magnifying glass).
    2. Search for "tag:vocab_know". Select all cards with ctrl-a. Actions->Generate Cards. Choose "Meaning->Japanese".
    3. Generate Kanji->Reading for cards with "kanji_r", and both Kanji->Reading and Reading->Kanji for "kanji_rw".
  3. Delete temporary cards.
    1. Some extra cards were generated when you imported everything. Still in the search tool, search for "tag:vocab_old tag:Japanese->Meaning". Select and delete all cards.

Using Anki

Anki uses a "spaced repetition" system, where each correct respons (as judged by the user) increases the time period before the card will be shown again. In order to review all cards for some category, you have to choose the "Cram" option.

Click the stopwatch button at any time to go to the review options screen. Here you can set which tags are shown, as well as other options. To find or modify cards, click the magnifying glass button.

For more information, see the Anki Documentation
